content:
=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐English breakdown and analysis of the game:

1. Game Genre and Core Idea:
 • It’s a maze‐style puzzle/action game with some arcade elements. You navigate a grid-like level, explore corridors and rooms, and interact with objects and enemies.  
 • The game has adventure/puzzle aspects (finding a key and reaching a door) along with combat elements (using a sword to defeat enemies).

2. Game Mechanics:
 • Movement & Environment:  
  – The level is laid out in a grid with walls (that block or bounce you back) and floor tiles.  
  – You must maneuver around obstacles and use the environment carefully.
 • Object Collection and Transformation:  
  – The player starts as “nokey.” When the avatar touches a key object, it transforms into “withkey” (and you get a score bonus).  
  – Only with the key can you properly interact with the door (the goal) to win.
 • Combat and Enemy Interactions:  
  – The avatar can shoot a “sword” (an oriented flickering projectile) to eliminate enemies. When the sword touches an enemy, the enemy is killed and you gain points.  
  – Direct collisions between the avatar and an enemy, however, are punished (you lose points and risk death).  
  – Enemies come in several types (quick, normal, slow) with different “cooldown” (reaction/movement speed) parameters. They roam randomly, so you must time your moves to avoid them.
 • Other Interactions:  
  – Some objects (or maybe enemy sprites) will “step back” upon collision, meaning that some moves are negated if you run into them improperly (like trying to go through a wall or a door without a key).

3. Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 • Your primary goal is to reach the door (“goal”) while carrying the key. The door only lets you win when interacted with by the “withkey” version of your avatar.
 • Losing the game means the avatar is killed. An enemy colliding with you without proper combat or avoiding it might result in a loss.

4. Overall Strategy:
 • Explore the Maze: Start by navigating through the level to locate the key. Since touching the key transforms your avatar (and gives you points), hunting it down is your first step.
 • Avoid and Manage Enemies:  
  – Watch enemy movement patterns, especially since there are various speeds to contend with.  
  – Use your sword projectile smartly to eliminate enemies from a distance rather than colliding with them directly.
 • Prepare for the Door: Once you have the key, you can now interact with the door. It’s wise to clear nearby enemy threats before going for the exit.
 • Tactical Movement: Use the walls and level layout to your advantage, avoiding unnecessary confrontations and using “step back” interactions to maintain safe positioning.
 • Score Bonus: While progressing, also keep an eye on opportunities to increase your score by defeating enemies with your sword and by transforming your avatar properly.

In summary, you need to balance exploration (to grab the key), cautious navigation (to dodge or fight off enemies using your ranged sword), and timing (to reach the goal door safely). Thinking ahead about enemy movement and planning an optimized path through the maze is the key to victory in this game.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== High Level Plan === 


Evaluation: BAD 
Feedback: The agent’s move did not change the state at all, making no progress toward reaching the key or goal, nor did it enhance its position. The lack of forward movement or strategic benefit makes this action ineffective despite not introducing extra risk, with a reward of None from the environment

Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
floor goal -> 'g'
floor key -> '+'
floor nokey -> 'A'
floor monsterQuick -> '1'
floor monsterNormal -> '2'
floor monsterSlow -> '3'
wall -> 'w'
floor -> '.'
goal -> '@'
key -> '#'
monsterNormal -> '$'
monsterQuick -> '%'
monsterSlow -> '&'
nokey -> '*'

=== Current State ===
=== Original State ===
wwwwwwwwwwwww
w..&.ww....*w
w....w......w
w.w.....wwwww
w#w........%w
w.w..wwwwwwww
w.......w...w
w...$w....w@w
wwwwwwwwwwwww

=== Rotated State (Y-axis emphasis) ===
wwwwwwwww
w...#...w
w..www..w
w......&w
w$......w
ww.w..www
w..w...ww
w..w....w
w.ww.w..w
w..w.w..w
ww.w.w..w
w@.w%w.*w
wwwwwwwww
Note: In the original state, each row corresponds to horizontal (left-right) layout in the game.
In the rotated version, each row corresponds to vertical (up-down) layout.=== Map in Natural language ===

Action:2

I'm moving left from my current position to start heading towards the key, which aligns with our strategy of obtaining the key before approaching the door.
